title: Inconsistent behavior of MediaPlayer StepForwardOneFrame and StepBackOneFrame methods
body: Repeatedly calling MediaPlayer.StepForwardOneFrame() `MediaPlayer.StepBackOneFrame() should switch between two frames, but video is moving slightly back.

comments.body: As @robloo pointed out - this method is called StepOneFrame(). Not MoveBy0_42Seconds()... So my intention when using StepOneFrame() methods is to step one frame regardless current frame rate...

The method is called StepBackOneFrame(). If it doesn't take into account the framerate this is a bug. It's good the documentation is updated to explain what is going on. However, the method itself should be fixed. Don't turn a bug into a feature like this.
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. For now we are updating the documentation to explain the actual behavior for the StepBackOneFrame method:
